DOC.brief_summary: Is dual-task obstacle cross train efficiently single-task obstacle cross train improvement walk ability , balance ability , low extremity muscle strength ambulatory subject spinal cord injury
DOC.brief_title: Dual-task Obstacle Crossing Training Ambulatory Subjects With Spinal Cord Injury
DOC.detailed_description: To compare immediate effect dual-task single-task obstacle cross train ambulatory subject spinal cord injury
DOC.criteria: independent ambulatory subject traumatic cause nonprogressive disease subacute chronic stage injury ( least 3 month injury ) body mass index ( BMI ) 18.529.9 kg/m2 walk independently least 17 meter without assistive device ( Functional Independence Measure Locomotor ( FIML ) score 57 ) able read Thai pain musculoskeletal system pain scale 5 10 visual analog scale ( VAS ) deformity joint affect ambulatory ability unable understand command test use study
